<!-- # Cover Letter -->

<!-- # Abstract -->

<!-- Juliano Palacios Abrantes is a postdoctoral researcher at the Jensen’s Lab of the University of Wisconsin. His work looks at how shifts in marine species are having uncertain feedbacks on marine ecosystems and dependent fishing communities. Specifically, he looks at how such shifts affect transboundary stocks (e.g., stocks that cross international borders) accentuating sources of conflict, and highlighting the need for adaptive, collaborative, ecosystem- based management strategies. -->

Jensen’s Lab, Center for Limnology, University of Wisconsin-Madison; Advisor: Dr. Olaf Jensen

  Bren School of Environmental Science and Management, University of California at Santa Barbara, USA; Advisor, Dr. John Melack

  Universidad Autónoma Metropolitana campus Xochimilco, México City; Advisor, Dr. Virginia Melo
